events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on March 30th, resulting in damage to the front bumper and left headlight.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the reported keywords related to vehicle damage and collision.
An insurance agent specializing in auto accidents was assigned to handle the claim and guide the customer through the process.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the customer with details on next steps and expected timelines for processing.
Request sent to the customer for submission of the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a medical report if applicable.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, vehicle repair estimate, and photos of the accident site.
Investigation commenced to verify the circumstances of the auto accident and to assess the extent of reported damages.
Investigation concluded that the damage was consistent with the reported collision and no discrepancies were found.
A settlement offer was prepared based on the repair estimates and policy coverage limits and sent to the customer for review.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and appreciated the prompt handling of the claim.
Final approval for the claim was granted following confirmation of agreement on settlement terms by the customer.
The payment for vehicle repair costs was processed and issued to the customer's designated bank account.
The claim was officially closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation that the customerâ€™s vehicle was repaired.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived according to company policy for future reference if needed.
